description.raw:
![filesave_schematic.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3904031974-filesave_schematic.png)

This pull request implements the file save behavior and GUI changes depicted in the above schematic (courtesy of Louise). It also provide a fix for issue 396: the building editor creates a folder with model.config and model.sdf files for a saved model, adds it to the model path, and notifies the InsertModelWidget to make the model is available in the "Insert Model" tab.

Disclaimer: There are a few known issues that I am leaving for future work:

~~1. On some computers, saving a model to the home folder causes Gazebo to crash. This happens if the hidden folder ~/.dbus is owned by root. If instructed to write to the home folder, the program will first attempt to write to .dbus, which will lead to a permission denied exception. This could be fixed by adding a try/catch block around the write, but this still does not allow the user to write models to the home folder. Suggestions for a complete fix are welcome.~~ independent of this pull request, will be solved in [PR 1329](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1329)

2. I believe the changes to FinishBuildingDialog should get merged into gui::SaveDialog and SaveDialog should be used in BuildingMaker. I am leaving this for a different pull request until after I have taken a closer look at SaveDialog.
description.html:
This pull request implements the file save behavior and GUI changes depicted in the above schematic (courtesy of Louise). It also provide a fix for issue 396: the building editor creates a folder with model.config and model.sdf files for a saved model, adds it to the model path, and notifies the InsertModelWidget to make the model is available in the "Insert Model" tab.

Disclaimer: There are a few known issues that I am leaving for future work:

1. On some computers, saving a model to the home folder causes Gazebo to crash. This happens if the hidden folder ~/.dbus is owned by root. If instructed to write to the home folder, the program will first attempt to write to .dbus, which will lead to a permission denied exception. This could be fixed by adding a try/catch block around the write, but this still does not allow the user to write models to the home folder. Suggestions for a complete fix are welcome. independent of this pull request, will be solved in PR 1329

  1. I believe the changes to FinishBuildingDialog should get merged into gui::SaveDialog and SaveDialog should be used in BuildingMaker. I am leaving this for a different pull request until after I have taken a closer look at SaveDialog.

title.raw: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons
title.html: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

summary.html:
This pull request implements the file save behavior and GUI changes depicted in the above schematic (courtesy of Louise). It also provide a fix for issue 396: the building editor creates a folder with model.config and model.sdf files for a saved model, adds it to the model path, and notifies the InsertModelWidget to make the model is available in the "Insert Model" tab.

Disclaimer: There are a few known issues that I am leaving for future work:

1. On some computers, saving a model to the home folder causes Gazebo to crash. This happens if the hidden folder ~/.dbus is owned by root. If instructed to write to the home folder, the program will first attempt to write to .dbus, which will lead to a permission denied exception. This could be fixed by adding a try/catch block around the write, but this still does not allow the user to write models to the home folder. Suggestions for a complete fix are welcome. independent of this pull request, will be solved in PR 1329

  1. I believe the changes to FinishBuildingDialog should get merged into gui::SaveDialog and SaveDialog should be used in BuildingMaker. I am leaving this for a different pull request until after I have taken a closer look at SaveDialog.
